benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC04) cover successful retrievals for latest catalog, specific requestedDate, accountId, and both together.
Empty Response / No Data: TC05 and TC15 cover cases where no catalog exists or catalog contains no products, validating 4xx/200 empty-XML responses.
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC16) for valid/invalid combinations, formats, max-lengths, unsupported params, and non-matching dates.
Authorization & Access Control: TC10 and TC11 validate missing auth (401) and insufficient permissions (403).

Error Handling: TC06, TC07, TC08, TC12, TC22 and TC13 cover many error responses (invalid params, service unavailable, timeout, injection attempts) consistent with acceptance criteria (>=400 responses).
Content-Type / Response Format: Many scenarios assert text/xml and well-formed XML (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC19, TC20), including regression and backward-compatibility checks for schema/format.
Performance & Scalability: TC17, TC21 include large-catalog and peak-load performance checks and SLAs; TC18 covers concurrent requests and race-condition concerns.
Resilience & Recovery: TC14 (transient network recovery) and TC12 (dependency down) exercise recovery and degraded behavior.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios test pagination or chunked/partial retrieval for very large catalogs (the GET guidelines explicitly call out pagination).
Caching Behavior: No tests for HTTP caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control), conditional GETs (If-None-Match / 304 behavior), or cache invalidation on catalog change.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits, request throttling, or expected 429 responses under high request rates.
Content Negotiation and Accept Headers: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., application/xml vs text/xml) or client preference behavior.
Header-level validation: No explicit checks for other relevant headers such as Content-Length, Content-Encoding, or ensuring proper character encoding (charset).
Pagination-related performance: Although large-catalog performance is tested, there are no tests validating streaming, memory usage, or partial responses when dataset exceeds service limits.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: simulate very large catalogs with page/limit query parameters (if supported) and verify correct paging behavior, metadata, and consistency across pages.

Add caching & conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Last-Modified headers, conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) return 304 when appropriate, and Cache-Control settings are present and correct.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate high request rates to verify 429 responses, proper Retry-After header, and graceful handling of throttling.
Add content negotiation tests: send requests with different Accept headers (application/xml, text/xml, */*) and validate server selects an appropriate content type or returns 406 where appropriate.
Add header validation tests: assert Content-Length/Content-Encoding and correct character encoding; validate behavior for very large Content-Lengths and streaming scenarios.
Add tests for conditional updates/invalidation: ensure retrieving catalog after updates returns new version (cache invalidation) and that date-based retrievals reflect concurrent updates as expected.
